headline: Asian markets track Wall St record after Fed cut
summary: Asian equities rose Friday as investors tracked a record day on Wall Street in the wake of the Federal Reserve's latest interest rate cut.Still, investors in New York continued to look at the positives, pencilling in more cuts next year and pushing the S&P 500 and Dow to fresh records.

thumbnail.caption: Markets rose across most of Asia following a record day on Wall Street (ISAAC LAWRENCE)

headline: Asia Market Open: Bitcoin Ticks Up As Asian Markets Gain After S&P 500 Record

headline: Asian shares track US stock market's rise to record highs despite AI bubble worries
summary: Asian shares rose on Friday, tracking Wall Street’s climb to records despite a sell-off for Oracle as worries persisted about a potential bubble  in artificial-intelligence technology.  U.S. futures fell while oil prices advanced.  Investors remain cautious ahead of next week’s policy meeting of the Bank of Japan, where it is expected to raise interest rates, but technology shares helped lead broad gains.

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Inch Higher amid Slower Global Inflation
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Friday, Dec, 12 2025 US stock futures are pointing slightly higher this morning, with S&P 500 contracts up around 0.1 percent as investors balance fresh central bank moves with cooling inflation abroad. The US 10 year Treasury yield is steady near 4.16 percent after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point and signaled just one more cut next year, which keeps borrowing costs high but no longer climbing. At the same...

headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Oracle's Outlook
summary: Tech fell behind. The Dow industrials surged a day after a Federal Reserve move viewed by some as a "dovish" rate cut. The Dow added 646 points, or 1.3%, to close at a record. The S&P 500 added just 0.

content.title: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Oracle's Outlook
content.summary: Tech fell behind. The Dow industrials surged a day after a Federal Reserve move viewed by some as a "dovish" rate cut. The Dow added 646 points, or 1.3%, to close at a record. The S&P 500 added just 0.

headline: Broadcom falls as margin pressures add to AI payoff jitters
summary: Broadcom shares fell nearly 5% before the market open on Friday after the chipmaker said its margins would fall ​due to a higher mix of AI revenue, adding to worries ‌about the payout from AI.  Investor optimism over the nascent technology has recently cooled amid bubble concerns, ‌wiping out hundreds of billions in tech market value since late October.Adding to the worries, Oracle's massive spending and weak forecasts fanned doubts over how quickly the big bets on AI will pay off, sparking a tech selloff in the ⁠previous session.  "Right now, the ‌spending intentions still seem so big by so many, hitting that panic button is premature," said Ben Reitzes, analyst at ‍Melius Research.

content.title: Broadcom falls as margin pressures add to AI payoff jitters

"Right now, the ‌spending intentions still seem so big by so many, hitting that panic button is premature," said Ben Reitzes, analyst at ‍Melius Research.

headline: World shares track US stock market's rise to record highs despite AI bubble worries
summary: World shares rose on Friday, tracking Wall Street’s climb to records despite a sell-off for Oracle as worries persisted about a potential bubble  in artificial-intelligence technology.  Investors remain cautious ahead of next week’s policy meeting of the Bank of Japan, where it is expected to raise interest rates, but technology shares helped lead broad gains.

headline: Bitcoin Falls as AI Bubble Fears Weigh
summary: Bitcoin was falling on concerns about lofty artificial intelligence-related stocks following results from Oracle and Broadcom. Broadcom shares dropped in after-hours trade after the chip company's sales outlook fell short of expectations and it warned of lower margins in AI revenue compared to non-AI revenue.

content.title: Bitcoin Falls as AI Bubble Fears Weigh
content.summary: Bitcoin was falling on concerns about lofty artificial intelligence-related stocks following results from Oracle and Broadcom. Broadcom shares dropped in after-hours trade after the chip company's sales outlook fell short of expectations and it warned of lower margins in AI revenue compared to non-AI revenue.
